title: VZ Product Management Intern, Summer 2021
requirements:
Position Summary

Samsung has been a leading force in innovation for decades. We believe that technology can, and should, make the world a better place, so we create new possibilities for people everywhere. We strive to create a place of endless learning where we’re pushed to discover our true potential. Our interns take real-world business problems and lead the charge on formulating creative solutions. Our structured program prepares every intern for success by allowing them to fully integrate into our dynamic culture while contributing their own unique ideas. We create opportunities for both undergraduate and graduate students to impact change and make the impossible possible. Join #LifeatSamsung.

Role and Responsibilities



Position Summary

Product Experience
Identify areas for improvement of customer experience on current products and services.
Gather VOCs on recently launch enhanced experiences and develop recommendations on feature improvements. 
Data analysis of market and business trends, competitive and Samsung’s product offerings, quality metrics, quality issues (pre- and post- product launch), VoC device lifecycle management
Work with product management and product planning teams, customer service, reverse logistics, and manufacturing to drive improvements based on analysis.

Skills and Qualifications



Qualifications



MBA with technical background or experience.  Prefer mobile technologies background, having a passion for improving consumer electronics experience and bringing technology to market.  App design or development a plus.



Internship Eligibility Requirements:

Must be enrolled in an accredited University Maintain a 3.0 or higher GPA
Provide proper work authorization to University Relations
Attend Intern Orientation on first day

* Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. If you are European Economic Resident, please click here .



* Samsung Electronics America, Inc. and its subsidiaries are committed to employing a diverse workforce, and  provide Equal Employment Opportunity for all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Product Management Intern - Summer 2021
requirements:
Squarespace is a design-centric product company at heart which enables anyone to build a beautiful online presence. Product Managers at Squarespace are embedded within product teams amongst product designers, engineers, researchers, and analysts. Our product teams are deeply collaborative, and each member is directly responsible for the team's success.

As an intern, you will work alongside full-time product managers on our Presence team this is responsible for our web applications. You will be challenged in an ambitious, ever-changing organization that values vision, execution, persistence, curiosity, and flexibility.

Responsibilities
Own solving a customer problem end-to-end, from strategy to execution by working directly with a full-time Squarespace product manager and a team of designers and engineers
Partner with Product Analysts and UX Research to conduct and examine direct user feedback, qualitative research, and quantitative data to define customer pain points in the website styling space.
Develop hypotheses and drive creative, cross-functional ideation and solution discovery
Define a set of metrics to measure customer satisfaction and business impact with the ability to analyze them and utilize them in decision making processes
Maintain communication with the entire team to ensure effective collaboration and transparency
Present findings broadly to interested product teams throughout the company


Qualifications
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Human-Computer Interaction, Business or a related field with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship
You have strong written and interpersonal communication skills
Familiar with web technologies (coding experience not required)

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
Product Management Intern

Monster Worldwide is seeking a Product Management Intern to join the team at our Weston, MA headquarters! You’re studying for a degree in a technical field and have researched, searched and applied to jobs on various job boards so let’s put that knowledge to work! We are looking for a Product Manager Intern who has a strong interest in the product management field and a desire to help deliver positive user experiences. In this role, you’ll collaborate with members of Monster’s Product, UX Design and Development teams to define, document, implement and test enhancements to Monster’s Candidate experience.

Responsibilities 
Identify and fill software product gaps and generate new ideas that help achieve Monster’s KPIs
Work with members of the Candidate Product and UX Design teams to identify opportunities to improve the Monster experience
Translate product strategy into requirements that can be turned into user stories for implementation
Create and review user and data flows

Job Requirements
Working toward a degree in computer science, Engineering, Product Management or a related subject
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done
Self-starter with strong desire to learn and contribute
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Use of online tools such as Aha! Jira, and Confluence a plus
Experience with mobile apps a plus
 About Monster
Monster is a global leader in connecting people to jobs, wherever they are. For more than 20 years, Monster has helped people improve their lives with better jobs, and employers find the best talent. Today, the company offers services in more than 40 countries, providing some of the broadest, most sophisticated job seeking, career management, recruitment, and talent management capabilities.
Monster continues its pioneering work of transforming the recruiting industry with advanced technology using intelligent digital, social, and mobile solutions, including our flagship website monster.com® and a vast array of products and services.

Accessibility Accommodation
Monster is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment through a culture of diversity, equity, safety, and belonging. Our goal is to make work a happy and productive place for all through transparency and accountability at all levels of our organization. 

If there’s an accommodation you need or prefer as part of your application, or if you have some feedback for us on ways we can make our process more accessible for all, please send us an email at talentacquisition@monster.com or call 1-800-MONSTER and let us know how we can help! 

Please do not direct any general employment related questions to this email and/or phone number. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodations will be responded to from this email address and/or phone number. 

Monster is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer committed to creating a diverse environment. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment regardless of Race, Religion, Color, National Origin, Citizenship, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, Age, Disability, Ancestry, Veteran Status, Genetic Information, Service in the Uniformed Services or any other classification protected by law.

title: Product Management Intern - Summer 2021
requirements:
We are seeking talented students to help us build the next generation database platform. Join the team that is helping the world’s most sophisticated organizations transform their industries by harnessing the power of data. Our internship program is based in our New York City office.

As an intern you will work directly with MongoDB’s product managers, user experience designers and engineers. You will be fully integrated into the team helping to analyze user’s pains and advocate on their behalf, mine various data sources to discover new product requirements, develop and communicate product strategy to relevant stakeholders, maintain roadmaps and prioritize product/sprint backlogs, and deliver & launch new capabilities to drive our product strategy.

Our summer program is comprehensive and interactive - you won’t sit behind a desk all day. We have social outings (think team dinners, broadway shows, NYC sightseeing, and more) and an intern speaker series where you’ll hear from some of the most significant and important people in tech today. You’ll gain insight into what makes a billion dollar company run. At the end of the summer you’ll be a better program manager and a more informed citizen of the world.

What We Are Looking For In You...
You are in the process of receiving a Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Data Science, or related fields. Alternatively you have a background in STEM and are now pursuing your MBA
You have solid technical skills — our users are software engineers, DBA's, sysadmins, etc. Our product managers must be just as technical and have working knowledge in these areas to better advocate for our users; while not expected to write production code, you should be comfortable diving into new code, learning from existing examples, exploring APIs, triaging bugs, analyzing support cases, and speaking on any of the technical aspects of the tools in your portfolio
You are an excellent communicator, both through verbal and written means
You are curious and have a strong desire to learn and adapt; you are a self starter and thrive in ambiguity


What You'll Find At MongoDB…
You will get a crash course in product management at a marquee tech company
You will get first hand experience in how a $10B company makes short term and long term strategic decisions (despite our size, we have a very small, highly leveraged product team!)
You will get hands on experience in building “deep tech” products, such as distributed databases
You will get a mix of ‘product experience’, from building a business case for a new product line to tactical product management with engineering teams, to overseeing the commercialization of new products
You will have a front row seat to see a major secular shift in the database industry
You will understand the hard work necessary to consistently innovate and build a lasting business

*MongoDB, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
Help us make personal digital security understandable and accessible at Tall Poppy!

About The Role

We are looking for a product management intern to help imagine & build tools to bolster personal digital security & support people at risk of online harassment & abuse.

You'll Be Asked To Help With
Testing & quality assurance for new features.
Product research & ideation.
Writing feature descriptions.
Communicating & facilitating conversations with engineers.


[You don't already need to be experienced at any of this, but professional fluency in English is required.]

This summer internship will be remote, coordinating with Tall Poppy's small team of nine via Slack and video conferencing. You'll mostly be working with Tom (product lead) and Erica (head of engineering), who are both based in the San Francisco Bay area and keep Pacific working hours. We expect the role to be full time, but are more than happy to be flexible about this and about specific hours.

This 2021 summer internship is aimed at students in the U.S. and Canada. While non-student applicants will be considered, the role will have the essential character of an internship — in particular, it will be limited in time to a few months. This is a paid position at $20-$30 USD/hour.

We read every application, especially cover letters. We are particularly excited to hear what interests you about Tall Poppy and the things we work on.

About Tall Poppy

Tall Poppy builds tools and services to help companies protect their employees against online harassment and abuse. We combine proactive security training, threat monitoring, and detection with incident response when an individual comes under attack. In addition to our standard service, we offer additional capabilities for high-profile or executive staff who face increased risk, and also work with content creators and influencers who face their own unique set of challenges.

title: Product Management Internship
requirements:
Our Product Management Internship will provide a hands-on experience in a challenging, interesting, and rewarding environment. Qualified interns will experience different functions of our Product Management department; including working on product strategy, product development, and competitive intelligence.

As an intern, you will be provided the opportunity to directly impact GEICO's growth and profitability by working alongside other product managers to develop and execute product design strategies for our insurance business. You will be responsible for looking creatively at business problems and working on long-term projects throughout the summer. Towards the end of your internship, you will present your findings and recommendations to senior management.

Starting from day one, your work will have an impact, forming the basis for truly transformative solutions. If you have a passion for problem solving and you are interested in making a real contribution at the 2nd largest auto insurer in the United States, then a GEICO Product Management Internship may be the right fit for you!

During This Paid 10-week Summer Internship, You Will
Research creative ways to assess risk
Understand and more accurately predict customer behavior
Work on projects that will determine the likelihood of a loss
Query large datasets via SAS and organize and analyze in Excel
Develop and present projects to senior management
Learn how GEICO collaborates with state insurance departments and regulators
Qualifications
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in one of the following fields of study: Economics, Business, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related major
Candidates must be rising seniors by the start of internship (i.e. graduating in December 2021 or May 2022)
Cumulative GPA of at least a 3.0 or higher
Excellent quality, communication, problem solving, and creative thinking abilities
Demonstrated analytical, mathematical, and data management skills
Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Excel and some additional programming skills
Ability to live and work in the Washington DC area this summer. Interns who meet geographical requirement may qualify for housing stipend.
You can also check out our jobs on LinkedIn,

Note: The safety of our associates, both current and future, is GEICO’s highest priority. At this time, most of our associates are working remotely due to the current COVID-19 pandemic. Candidates who are selected for this position may be trained remotely and must be able to work from home in a designated work area. Once GEICO determines it is safe for associates to return to the office, candidates may be required to work in our Chevy Chase, MD office.

The equal employment opportunity policy of the GEICO Companies provides for a fair and equal employment opportunity for all associates and job applicants regardless of race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, familial status, disability or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law. GEICO hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the job to be filled.

GEICO reasonably accommodates qualified individuals with disabilities to enable them to receive equal employment opportunity and/or perform the essential functions of the job, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship to the Company. This applies to all applicants and associates. GEICO also provides a work environment in which each associate is able to be productive and work to the best of their ability. We do not condone or tolerate an atmosphere of intimidation or harassment. We expect and require the cooperation of all associates in maintaining an atmosphere free from discrimination and harassment with mutual respect by and for all associates and applicants.

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
Description

Join us in making roads safer by making drivers better!

Career Opportunities At CMT Include, But Not Limited To The Following

As a CMT Intern, you will work closely with members of our Claims group who will provide mentorship and guidance. You will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment, while contributing to product development and helping to make roads safer.
Work with Product Managers to help invent, shape, and launch new features and products for CMT.
Collaborate closely with our engineering team regarding the feature specifications and their development, testing, and release.
Write detailed requirements for features based on well-defined use cases and in some cases, create initial wireframes to illustrate them.
Requirements
Enrolled in an academic program as a sophomore, junior or senior working towards Bachelors of Science, Computer Science, Engineering or similar quantitative field
Strong communication skills
Attention to detail and well organized
Ability to work independently
SDL2019-64

title: Product Manager Intern (Summer 2021)
requirements:
Gusto is first and foremost Customer Driven. We value thoughtfulness and empathy. We take pride in making smart decisions based on customer research, design sprints and prototyping while balancing short and long term technical decisions. Engineering, Product and Design collaborate as equals.

About Gusto

Gusto is a modern, online people platform that helps small businesses take care of their teams. On top of full-service payroll, Gusto offers health insurance, 401(k)s, expert HR, and team management tools. Today, Gusto offices in Denver, San Francisco, and New York serve more than 100,000 businesses nationwide.

Our mission is to create a world where work empowers a better life, and it starts right here at Gusto. That’s why we’re committed to building a collaborative and inclusive workplace, both physically and virtually. Learn more about our Total Rewards philosophy.

Our Product Management team is looking for strategic problem solvers to join our team for a Summer 2021 internship. As a Product Management Intern, you'll work and learn alongside product managers, engineers and operational teams to apply your skills to real world problems.

Not only will your work at Gusto help the more than 100,000 small businesses we already serve, but Gusto is growing so quickly that you’ll have a large personal impact on the trajectory of our business.

Here’s What You’ll Do Day-to-day
Collaborate with Engineering, Product, and Design to release a product feature
Execute strategic market analysis on trends, competitors, and customers
Understand customer pain points, propose solutions, and then prototype, iterate, and launch
Develop a compelling vision, strategy, and roadmap
Present insights and findings to key stakeholders and leaders


Examples Of Previous Intern Projects Include

Interns will be matched to a Gusto product team based on background, interest, and company needs.
Improving onboarding for newly hired employees of Gusto customers, focused on creating a warm and personal welcome experience.
Driving conversion for a product-add on by analyzing funnel opportunities and deepening our integration with an external partner.


Here’s What We're Looking For
Students pursuing an advanced degree in Business, Computer Science or Management Science and graduating between December 2021 and Summer 2022
2+ years experience in a highly strategic, analytical and operational role in fast-paced environments
Passion for creating memorable experiences for customers
Structured problem solver and expert in prioritizing features
Strong product sense

Our cash compensation amount for this role is targeted at $46.16-$51.93/hr in most locations. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including candidate experience and expertise, and may vary from the amount listed above.

Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for small businesses, you will find a home at Gusto.

Gusto is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Gusto considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Gusto is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@gusto.com.

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
At AriensCo, we build more than exceptional products – we create opportunities that impact careers. Our culture values innovative thinking, hard work and determination. We interact in teams, collaborate together and make decisions quickly.

We see growth potential in every team member, and are committed to supporting our employees with continuous training and advancement opportunities.

Our environment? We’re corporate, without being “corporate.” Whether you work at our headquarters, manufacturing facilities, or one of our global distribution businesses, you’ll always have the freedom to create and contribute. Our company vision is “Passionate People, Astounded Customers.” Quite simply: it revolves around people

Speaking of people, you’re not just employee #1,762 to us. You’re family and your role is invaluable. Without exceptional people, we can’t continue to produce the amazing products we're known for around the world.

Ready for the ride of your career? Then come join us. By joining our team, you'll have the opportunity to work in a rewarding workplace with a strong sense of community.

Job Description

AriensCo is looking for self-starting, motivated Product Management Intern for Summer 2021 who is looking for practical hands-on experience. This is the perfect opportunity to enhance your education with practical hands-on experience to prepare you for your future. At AriensCo, “Our Legacy is Your Future.”

This is a support role primarily for product management staff. You will interact with marketing, engineers, industrial design, sales, and other cross-functional project stakeholders on a daily basis.

THE DAY TO DAY…
Support marketing product management staff by performing basic assignments in defining and delivering outdoor power products.
This can involve participation with research, competitive analysis, data analysis, customer persona creation, planning, volume forecasting, voice of customer definition, product specifications, and presentations to multiple levels of leadership.


In This Internship You Will Gain Experience With
Market Research
Brand/Product Strategy
Executive Communication and Presentations
Competitive Assessment
Product Launch Planning

You Will Be Exposed To
Cross-functional interaction with marketing, industrial design, engineering, manufacturing, and sales
Product lifecycle planning
Project management tools and methodologies
Power equipment retail channels and dealer network
Photo/Video shoots and digital asset creation
Social Media assets and channels
Advertising and Promotion

The Qualifications…
Must be enrolled as a student at an accredited university studying toward a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Entrepreneurship, or similar
Must have and maintain a minimum G.P.A. of 3.0/4.0
Should be creative, curious, analytical and have an interest new products
About AriensCo
Since 1933, the AriensCo name has been associated with reliable, durably crafted, high-performance outdoor power equipment. Our core values – Be Honest, Be Fair, Respect the Individual, Keep our Commitments, and Encourage Intellectual Curiosity define our culture and inspire our team. We believe passionate people and astounded customers lead to unstoppable success.

AriensCo Employees Are Provided Various Great Benefit Opportunities Which May Include

Our employees’ quality of life is important to us. When people feel appreciated, respected and supported, careers thrive and ideas come to fruition.
Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance effective first day of employment
Onsite health clinic with Bellin Health
Life Insurance
401(k) and profit-sharing plans
Bonus Programs
Accident and Critical Illness Insurance
Paid vacation, holidays and leave programs
Flexible spending account (FSA) plan
Voluntary wellness programs
Employee Product discount program
Employee Assistance Program
Gym discount membership program
Tuition Reimbursement
Safety shoes and safety prescription glasses reimbursement
Apprenticeship opportunities
Cross-training and job rotation opportunities
Career paths
Ongoing development through the Ariens Academy
Kaizen Events - continuous improvement
Ability to win products
Daycare (coming Fall 2021)

EEO Statement

The concept of diversity is important to us at AriensCo. That’s why we’ve created a culture that is inclusive, accepting and understanding. We embrace diversity among our partners, suppliers and employees. We also strive for diversity in the quality of our ideas. Inclusion and acceptance means that, regardless of who you are, you will always be standing on our welcome mat.

AriensCo is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. AriensCo hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the job to be filled.

Providing our employees with an environment free of discrimination and harassment is something we take very seriously. Embracing diversity enables us to attract the best talent, foster productive teamwork, and expand our business opportunities.

title: Product Management Intern (Virtual)
requirements:
2021 Summer Intern Product Management

Virtual

The Commercial Real Estate (CRE) industry is at an inflection point. The technological disruptions that have already transformed retail, travel, and transportation have been slower to emerge here, but they are coming at full speed. JLL, a globally recognized leader in CRE, recognized these forces early, and is making massive investments in technology to transform both itself and the industry as a whole .

JLL Technologies (JLLT) is the tech arm of JLL, with the dual mandate of growing the company’s technology revenue while also driving market share and margin gains in our existing business. Our mission is to leverage technology to increase the value and liquidity of the world's buildings, while enhancing the productivity and the happiness of those that occupy them.

We are currently seeking a Summer Intern in Product Management to join our growing team . In this role, you will learn the craft of product management and have the opportunity to lead the definition, development and launch of a high impact feature on one of our key strategic products. JLL has multiple positions open under this Product Management role.

Areas of focus include-
Product market research and analysis
Product strategy
Product case studies
Project/program/portfolio management
Training and demos
Rollout support
Technical writing

What This Job Involves

As a Summer Intern in Product Management at JLL Technologies, you will -
Conduct user research to scope and define an enhancement to one of our products
Work with our design and engineering teams to develop the feature you recommend
Develop materials and collateral (e.g., email content) to publicize the change
Analyze the resulting data to measure the outcomes of your efforts

Desired Skills And Experience
Actively pursuing a technically-oriented bachelor’s degree , with 2-3 years completed (e.g., computer science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, etc.)
Minimum 1-2 computer science classes completed
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Exceptional verbal and written communication
Experience analyzing data in Excel or another data analysis platform

What You Can Expect From Us

We succeed together—across the desk and around the globe and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL T . Apply today!

JLL is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We strive to hire qualified, diverse candidates, and we will provide reasonable accommodations for known disabilities.

JLL is committed to creating a diverse intern program and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status

title: Product Management Intern – Summer 2021
requirements:
Who We Are

NanoString Technologies ( NASDAQ: NSTG ) is a leading provider of life science tools for discovery and translational research. The company’s nCounter® Analysis System is used in life sciences research and has been cited in more than 3,800 peer-reviewed publications. The nCounter Analysis System offers a cost-effective way to easily profile the expression of hundreds of genes, proteins, miRNAs, or copy number variations, simultaneously with high sensitivity and precision, facilitating a wide variety of basic research and translational medicine applications. The company’s GeoMx® Digital Spatial Profiler enables highly-multiplexed spatial profiling of RNA and protein targets in a variety of sample types, including FFPE tissue sections. Built on pioneering principles in 2003, NanoString is blazing new trails and exploring new frontiers to adapt to the everchanging landscape and becoming smarter and more innovative in the process. We are dedicated to advancing scientific discovery and providing solutions that can have a meaningful impact in research and discovery.

Our purpose is to Map the Universe of Biology. We enable scientists to answer questions they have always wanted to ask to explore the boundaries of cellular structures and create an atlas of biological interactions that define life. We are relentless in our quest to Catalyze the Next Biological Revolution leading to Advancing the Human Condition. In addition to a pioneering spirit, we value: Grit. Authenticity. Ambition. Ingenuity. Customers. Join our team!

Job Summary

Are you excited about developing novel products and creating new markets? NanoString is developing the GeoMx™ Digital Spatial Profiler (DSP) to enable high-plex protein or RNA expression analysis with morphological context from just one FFPE slide. NanoString provides an innovative work environment and as an intern, you will engage with a variety of departments, including R&D, Marketing, Technical Services, and Sales while focusing on market research that will help us grow the GeoMx DSP portfolio. Our ideal candidate will be self-motivated and eager to help identify new market opportunities and sharpen product positioning.

Essential Responsibilities
Assessing the market opportunity for new product concepts and applications through qualitative and quantitative market research
Informing development of customer facing marketing materials
How to represent NanoString in meetings as well as put together top level internal presentations that help generate excitement for new commercial ideas


Requirements
Background in biological sciences or related field
Self-motivated, highly organized, and meticulous in details
Keen analytical skills and a creative problem-solving approach
Strong communication skills


Preferred Qualifications
Marketing experience is a plus

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. title: Product Management Intern (REMOTE)
requirements:
Company Description

Tidepool is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization on a mission to make diabetes data more accessible, actionable, and meaningful for people with diabetes, their care teams, and researchers. Founded in 2013, Tidepool hosts a suite of free software tools for people with diabetes and the clinics that serve them, including Tidepool Web, Tidepool Mobile, Tidepool Uploader, and, pending submission to FDA and associated review, Tidepool Loop. Learn more at tidepool.org.

Follow us on Twitter at @Tidepool_org and on Facebook and Instagram.

Job Description

Product Management Intern

As a Product Management Intern, you’ll work with the product and design teams under a specific product area. You will gain experience in the full software development process at Tidepool from ideation through execution. You will own product features and work across teams to develop the roadmap, functional specifications, and designs of features that satisfy user needs.

What You’ll Do
Collaborate with design and development teams to identify, define, plan, and execute on improvements, new features, and new Tidepool products
Conduct user research to understand user problems and identify and define solutions with approval from stakeholders, breaking down projects into clear tasks.
Own and execute product and feature requirements, and thoroughly document them for Tidepool’s designers and engineers.
Use Tidepool’s project management tooling, Jira, to define product requirements and track development progress.
Participate in sprint planning, design and development huddles, and design reviews.
Collaborate with Tidepool’s QA team to ensure user requirements and well understood and properly tested.
Collaborate with Tidepool’s Marketing team on market research, user interviews, and more.
Define, measure, and monitor KPIs to track product performance.

In this role, you will spend time with end-users including people with diabetes, their families, and their clinicians to understand their pain points and to develop and validate product concepts.

You will excel in this role if you are an excellent communicator with the ability and interest to work with nearly every function across design, engineering, user operations, program management, and marketing. You should also be comfortable and productive working remotely.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate:
Personal passion for product, and an interest in delivering user-focused solutions.
A mix of previous internship, school project, volunteer and leadership experience.
A sense of urgency to do great things quickly.
Excellent communication skills with an ability to explain complex ideas to others.
Excellent organizational skills.
Experience managing complex projects.
Interest in user interviews is a bonus.
Knowledge of diabetes devices and apps is a bonus.
Experience with agile development is a bonus.

Additional Information

What you’ll receive
Full-time paid internship. Salary range is $20-$40/hour.
Guidance from a mentor.
Freedom to work from anywhere.
While many of Tidepool’s team members have a personal connection to diabetes, this is not a requirement. We do ask that you have empathy for chronic conditions and you are prepared to learn about the diabetes experience.

This is a remote position – you’ll be working from home and interacting with a team that works around the world, currently in 13 states and 5 countries. Learn more about working at Tidepool, including our approach to inclusion and diversity at Tidepool.org.

Does this sound like you? We’d love to hear from you!

Tidepool is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The company supports diversity and inclusion in its core values and does not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by U.S. federal or state law or local ordinance. When necessary, the company will reasonably accommodate employees and applicants with disabilities if the person is otherwise qualified to safely perform all of the essential functions of the position.

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
Description

Remote Summer Intern

Online education is no longer a novel or niche idea. It is the fastest-growing segment in higher education, accounting for 20% of all enrollees and 35% of graduate-level certificates and degrees. It's also getting increasingly competitive, as more and better programs are launched each semester. Universities need to go online quickly, economically, and elegantly, creating programs that students can't wait to tell their friends about and that their professors want to teach.

Noodle helps universities bring programs online with flexibility, transparency, alignment, efficiency, and joy. That's why more top universities chose us last year than all other online program managers combined. We are a passionate team of technologists, educators, and experts. Online learning has the potential to transform higher education; if you’re interested in being part of that journey, keep reading!

About The Internship Program

Our remote program is scheduled to start June 1st, 2021

Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis until the cohort is full. Noodle interns are paid $18/hour and work an average of 40 hours per week. If you are applying to our internship program, you must have proper authorization to work in the U.S. for the duration of the program.

About The Role

The product internship is an opportunity for motivated applicants to develop product management skills by working closely with product professionals at Noodle. Interns will gain experience with all stages of the product development lifecycle as they assist our team turn complex problems and ideas into features and technical solutions.

Product interns will work closely with their manager, collaborating cross-functionally across teams as necessary.

As Our Product Intern You Will
Assess product opportunities and contribute meaningfully to ideation and prioritization for new initiatives and products
W rite, define, and present product requirement for our designers and engineers to execute against
Analyze current stakeholder experiences to define friction points and create seamless and effortless experiences
Perform competitive market and growth analysis and research
Run rituals associated with agile methodology
As part of the Noodle community, you will also be able to take part in remote company-wide meetings and gatherings and are encouraged to learn from Noodlers across all our teams and companies, not just your own.

For the majority of the program, interns from all departments will have the opportunity to take part in weekly leadership talks or workshops aimed at providing practical advice for career growth and expanding intellectual horizons. Planned topics include personal branding, design thinking, personal finance, job search strategy, and more.

About You

We’re looking for self-starters who are not afraid to ask questions, communicate openly, and who can proactively find ways to help their team solve problems.

Noodle interns...
are community oriented - they have a group-first mentality, are generous with their time and energy and always express gratitude for their teammates’ contributions
are intellectually curious
are comfortable working in collaborative environments online
have excellent verbal and written communication skills
are comfortable creating documentation in industry-standard software
Google Docs/MS Office (presentation software, spreadsheets, text-based documents)
can effectively manage their schedules and projects
have a growth mindset
If this looks like you, please apply with a note on why we’re a good match along with your most recent CV! We look forward to seeing your name.

Why Work With Us?

An internship at Noodle will challenge both your industry knowledge and ability to work in the fast-paced environment of a rapidly scaling company. As we grow, we expect every employee - from intern to CEO - to own and propel projects with real impact. Our summer internship program is built for highly-motivated, positive, disciplined individuals who are not afraid to fail.

We offer an array of professional work opportunities across our teams, and this year we’ll have a focus on how to build and thrive in a successful remote working environment. During your time at Noodle, you will be mentored by some of our best and brightest, challenged with projects that have lasting impact on our business function, and will present a capstone project with your cohort’s recommendations to our executive team.

Noodle is committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive workplace for everyone. We value and celebrate our differences because those differences are what make our team shine. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes us stronger as a whole. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
At Shipt, we are transforming the grocery shopping experience and giving time back to consumers. Shipt shoppers handpick fresh groceries and household essentials, then deliver them to your door in as little as one hour.
As we continue to transform the delivery space and our multi-sided marketplace, we are showcasing opportunities and mentorship for interns as we develop the next generation of our team.

Shipt is looking to hire Product Management Interns focused on addressing the needs of our customers, shoppers and retailers. You will have the opportunity to work on growth, experience, and retention projects and learn from a broad team of experienced, passionate mentors. You witness first-hand, what it looks like to shape the future of our company. We are founded on the mission of simplifying lives; serving members, shoppers, retailers and communities by offering convenience and freedom.

In this role, you will learn about user experience, operational, and integration challenges as your team seeks to find the optimal balance between the needs of our business and the needs of our customers and shoppers and retailers. A natural fit of our interns is when they are always asking questions to learn more about the ‘Why’ and ‘How’ of the world. You are a natural leader and take ownership and pride in the quality of your work.

Responsibilities

Identify important, unmet needs and create innovative ways of solving them
Clearly communicate key set of business priorities to all levels of organization
Create product requirements documents and functional specifications
Manage project delivery and business expectations

Junior, Senior or Master's student pursuing their Bachelor’s degree
A passion for understanding customer problems and creating products to solve those problems
Strong interest in managing the execution of complex projects, including design, development and go-to-market
Strong analytical skills and a track record of data-driven decision making
Proven ability to collaborate with multi-site, cross-functional teams
Ability to present ideas to engineering, end users and cross-functional teams
Knowledge of Agile software development process is a plus

title: Product Management, Intern
requirements:
Your Responsibilities Involve Driving Projects For The RTI Connext Product Suite—our Secure, Real-time Connectivity Platform For The Industrial IoT—including

As a Product Management Intern, you are part of the team that sets the vision and strategy for the RTI product portfolio and manages the product life cycle that transforms that vision into reality. In this role, you will develop a deeper understanding of IIoT connectivity while working across multiple RTI teams to help discover, build and launch product capabilities.
Researching and capturing market and product requirements for industry-specific development workflows and improving out-of-the-box customer experience.
Developing go-to-market strategies and plans for new capabilities.
Creating sales and marketing content to support our field teams.
Updating and implementing PM processes (in tools like Confluence, Jira and Salesforce).

Real-Time Innovations (RTI) is the largest software framework provider for smart machines and real-world systems. Our software runs the largest power plants on the continent, connects perception to control in over 200 autonomous vehicles, drives the new generation of medical robotics, controls hyperloop and flying cars, and provides 24x7 medical intelligence to hospital patients and emergency victims. We are the best positioned small company in the world to create the very real future of intelligent, distributed systems.

RTI leads the world market for software that connects real-world devices. Our diverse and global workforce believes in working hard and enjoying the journey. We recognize employees for their achievements, offer great opportunities for career growth and development, and provide the tools they need to succeed. We also offer great benefits and flexibility. We commit to making your life as satisfying as your career. And, RTI's team is unmatched; our collaborative, transparent, and creative culture truly sets us apart from the rest.

We solve some of the greatest challenges in technology. Our mission is to transform industries: automotive, medical, power, defense, and control. Our core values emphasize excellence, teamwork, and your potential. Few small companies can truly claim to make the world run better like RTI. Come help make a real difference.

Responsibilities
Understand and analyze RTI market, customer and product needs to identify product gaps and opportunities.
Translate product opportunities into technical requirements and product backlogs.
Work with engineers to build and launch new features.
Develop sales & marketing tools, including product collateral, getting started procedures, presentations, competitive analysis, videos and blogs.


Qualifications
You are currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science or related technical field. Business administration coursework is nice to have.
You have excellent problem-solving, organizational, communication, presentation and interpersonal skills.
You have a passion for creating and analyzing products through understanding customer needs and market opportunities.
You have some software development experience and are comfortable compiling and running a HelloWorld application.


About RTI

We have a collaborative and inclusive environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers. Our culture embraces transparency, learning, and fun. We offer an attractive compensation package consisting of competitive salary, benefits, vacation bonuses, and equity participation.

RTI is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color national origin, sex, age status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Product Management Intern - 2021 Summer Internship
requirements:
About Us

Founded in 2009 and headquartered in San Jose, California, Nutanix is a passionate team of 6000+ employees worldwide. Our people (we call ourselves “Nutants”) are the heartbeat of #LifeAtNutanix and one of the many things that makes Nutanix a great place to work at. We share an intellectual curiosity, a bias for action, and an obsession for our customers. We are builders and problem solvers with an entrepreneurial spirit. Above all, we celebrate what makes each of us unique.

We are humbled to be recognized as one of Bloomberg’s Top 50 Companies to Watch in 2020 and one of the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® 2020 .

We’re growing fast and disrupting the computing industry. Join us and make your mark.

About Our Business

Nutanix is a global leader in cloud software and a pioneer in hyper-converged infrastructure solutions, making computing invisible anywhere. Companies around the world use Nutanix software to leverage a single platform to manage any app, at any location, at any scale for their private, hybrid and multi-cloud environments.

The Role

As part of the dynamic, core product management team focused on datacenter compute across VMs and Containers, we are seeking a motivated, technology product management intern. The intern role will focus on a research area(s) related to virtualization. Experience in datacenters, deep technology, or DevOps, paired with a strong work ethic and motivation to dig into complex topics is essential for success. The team is located around the world, but concentrated in San Jose, California.

Requirements
Product management experience is highly preferred, but not required.
Product Management coursework highly preferred (university, MOOC, online, etc.)
Strong writing skills and ability to clearly convey messaging
Demonstrable projects or products which incorporate vision, prioritization, technical solutions, and end-consumers a plus
Comfortable working with people across teams, organizations, and geographies
Some experience with software release processes (waterfall, Agile, Scrum, etc.) and associated assets generation (PRDs, MRDs, user stories).
Attention to detail
1-2 years of experience; preferably in a technical product field
High energy and excellent teamwork skills
Education:
BS in Computer Science, MIS, Engineering, Design, or related field
MBA student preferred
We’re an equal opportunity employer

title: Product Management MBA Intern - Summer 2021
requirements:

Are you interested in shaping the future of eCommerce?

Do you want to define how customers shop online outside of the US?

Are you passionate about product management?

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
Docugami is a Seattle-area document engineering startup that raised $10M seed round of VC funding in February 2020, and has earned multiple endorsements from industry leaders and publications.  We strive to transform how businesses create and manage documents for greater productivity, compliance, and insight using breakthrough artificial intelligence.

Applying AI to natural language processing (NLP) is today's next frontier.  Docugami specializes in inventing and implementing unique and creative techniques that push the boundaries of what is possible in document understanding, information extraction and document authoring assistance.

Product Management Interns at Docugami have "full stack" product responsibilities, working alongside our design, engineering, customer success, and sales teams to build an incredible product and drive growth. We are looking for PM Interns with technical backgrounds, who can be the bridge between different disciplines and drive customer value by understanding and driving product direction. Finally, we love PM Interns who are passionate about insights from data and solving problems with the user's perspective in mind.

You Will Love This Job If
You love solving hard problems
You are a "starter" who enjoys defining the direction and best practices of a product from the beginning
You seek opportunities to learn new things
You want to experience an early stage startup


What You'll Be Responsible For
Working directly with customers to build and iterate our backlog
Collaborating with other PMs and company leadership to constantly prioritize our backlog
Working with sales and marketing to drive growth and land customer success
Working with the design, engineering and science to deliver velocity against our backlog
Driving strategy, direction, investment, and end to end realization of our strategic vision


What We Look For In a Candidate
Studying Computer Science or Computer Engineering
Strong presentation, problem-solving, and time management skills
Data manipulation and querying skills - great at handling numbers/metrics/identifying KPIs
Passion for User Experience, examples of thought leadership


Perks
Competitive pay
Healthy snack stipend
Work closely with a cross-functional team of highly motivated folks with a unique range of startup, big enterprise, scientific, engineering, sales & marketing experience
Vibrant and inclusive company culture with frequent team-building events


About Us

Docugami is a Seattle-area document engineering startup that transforms how businesses create and manage documents for greater productivity, compliance, and insight using breakthrough artificial intelligence. Founded in March 2018 by former senior engineering leaders from Microsoft, Docugami harnesses a wide range of artificial intelligence techniques, including natural language processing, image recognition, declarative markup, and other approaches, to enable businesses of all sizes to radically improve how they create and manage documents for greater insight, efficiency, and business impact.

Learn more at www.docugami.com

We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives and are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team.

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
At Verizon Media, we connect people to their passions. With brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and more, we help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. From XR experiences to advertising and content technology, Verizon Media is an incubator of innovation and is revolutionizing the next generation of content creation in a 5G world.

2021 Product Management Intern

At Verizon Media, we connect people to their passions. With brands like Yahoo and TechCrunch, we help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. From XR experiences to advertising and content technology, Verizon Media is an incubator of innovation and is revolutionizing the next generation of content creation in a 5G world.

The Consumer Product Experiences (CPE) team is looking for aspiring product managers with a passion for technology, product, and design to join our Product Management Internship program and help tackle the biggest challenges in technology and media. This role will work directly with engineering, design, editorial, UXR and other groups to support our diverse set of Consumer-facing products. You will contribute directly to projects responsible for ensuring we reach our 2021 audience and revenue goals while meeting and exceeding the unique needs of our users.

About The Yahoo Product Management Internship Program

As a Verizon Media Product Management Intern you’ll join a team for 12 weeks and help execute the end-to-end product strategy and development for high-impact projects across the company. You’ll also be part of a selective community of product interns who will challenge and inspire you in your journey and be paired with senior product leaders to support your growth and evolution.

Responsibilities
Contribute to and execute product roadmaps oriented around our 2021 OKRs
Prioritize user needs and articulate what problem should be solved, for whom, how, and why
Work collaboratively with engineering, design and other key stakeholders.
Analyze performance based on agreed-upon success metrics
Work with product leads to groom the backlog and manage shifts in overarching priorities
Learn more about the broader Verizon Media business and its goals
Essential Qualities
Product sense: Strong product sense with an ability to envision technology solutions that address user needs and market opportunities
Analytical ability: Excellent problem solving and analytical skills: you should be able to break down open-ended problems and move forward in the face of ambiguity
Entrepreneurial spirit: Passion for technology products and services. Show us what you want to build. Tell us what products you love, how you want to change this space, and why
Communication skills: Strong written and oral communication skills in order to work effectively with engineering, design, and cross-functional teams

Nice To Have
Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program in Computer Science or related technical field.

About Verizon Media

Verizon Media, a subsidiary of Verizon, is the parent entity of Yahoo, AOL, TechCrunch, RYOT, HuffPost, and dozens of other brands that together reach more than a billion people every month. Creating and operating a diversity of media, communications, search, and advertising products at scale requires talented people to smartly apply technology, product insight, and user-focused design.

title: Mobile Product Management Intern (Summer 2021)
requirements:
The world is changing as we know it. It’s more important than ever that communications and entertainment services are available to users to connect wherever they may be. Here at Dolby, our mission is to enable experiences that transcend expectations and reach the spectacular. We need your creative solutions and diverse thought. The Dolby U internship program offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders.

Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. For any student seeking to gain invaluable expertise through meaningful, personal contributions, we invite you to join us in continuing to design a future where technology meets entertainment!

Summary

We are looking for an intern for the Mobile Audio product management team. This individual will work closely with product management, engineering, sales and marketing to support new projects for Dolby Atmos for smartphones, tablets, and headsets, develop data-driven customer engagement tools based on Voice-of-the-Customer analysis, and run testing and experimentation to define new product features and functionality for mobile audio experiences.

Responsibilities
Work closely with the product team on defining feature sets to deliver the best mobile audio entertainment experience
Perform analysis on Voice-of-the-Customer data, mapping and presenting findings for incorporation into the product roadmap for mobile devices
Run value proposition testing and experimentation for quantification and development of new feature ideas
Establish quantifiable metrics for gauging and presenting music/video performance in smartphones and tablets and headphones
Build data-driven customer engagement tools for sales and marketing across the globe

Multi-task and collaborate with broader cross-functional teams to drive decisions and gather consensus

High attention to detail
Strong written and oral communication skills, and strong presentation skills
Enthusiastic, resourceful, and comfortable wearing many hats
Experience with Excel and data analysis tools a plus
Knowledge of customer research methodologies a plus


ELIGIBILITY
Working towards a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field; recent grads who are within 1 year of graduation are also eligible to apply
Must be available to work full-time Monday – Friday for 3 months between May/June 2021 – August/September 2021. Start dates for the internship are as follows: (*note* these dates are not flexible)

Monday, June 14, 2021
Monday, June 21, 2021

title: Product Management Intern - Level Portfolio
requirements:
Gems Sensors & Controls (a Fortive company) is excited to offer a variety of roles for our 2021 intern cohort! Our 10-week internship program, running from June 7 - August 13, will consist of hands-on projects that allow you to apply classroom knowledge to real-world scenarios. At Gems/Fortive, we’re focused on continuous improvement in everything we do - that means our products, our processes, and our people. At the conclusion of the program, you will have the opportunity to report out on the work you’ve done, the impact you’ve had, and how you’ve developed over your time with us. From agricultural equipment to locomotives to medical devices, Gems products make a difference in the world you interact with every day.

PURPOSE OF POSITION

The Product Management Intern will work with the Product Management team to refine the market strategy for the level portfolio and support in developing value based pricing for key markets

Essential Functions
Develop deep understanding of the level market portfolio and key end-markets.
Understand the market trends and drivers for each end-market and impact to the level product portfolio.
Build a competitor map for the level portfolio and develop SWOT for key competitors.
Develop Value based pricing strategy for key market verticals, understanding the next best alternatives and value proposition.
Support product manager in value proposition to support the value based-pricing
Education & Experience Required
Majoring in Engineering or Marketing
Prior experience in Marketing is a plus
Strategy consulting experience a plus
Strong presentation and data analytics skills
Time management and priority setting
Strategic thinker
Collaborative
Comfortable with fast-paced work environment and problem-solving
PHYSICAL DEMANDS / ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is may be required to stand/or sit, squat, turn/twist, reach, use hands to: finger, handle, feel or operate objects, tools or controls, and computer keyboards.

The employee must occasionally lift, carry, push or pull up to 10 pounds.

The associate must also be willing and able to travel by all forms of transportation.

Fortive is headquartered in Everett, Washington and employs a team of more than 24,000 research and development, manufacturing, sales, distribution, service and administrative employees in more than 40 countries around the world. Our team grows by tackling challenges that accelerate progress and further their careers. With a culture rooted in continuous improvement, the core of our company’s operating model is the Fortive Business System. For more information please visit: www.fortive.com.

Gems Sensors & Controls (a Fortive company) designs and manufactures a broad portfolio of liquid level, flow, and pressure sensors, miniature solenoid valves, proximity switches and pre-assembled fluidic systems to exact customer application and manufacturing requirements. From agricultural equipment to locomotives to medical devices, Gems products make a difference in the world you interact with every day.
